parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "DEAPderiv",
    "time_limit": "00:30:00",
    "memory_per_cpu": "10gb",
    "temporary_storage": "50gb",
    "output_file": "output_logs/DEAPderiv_%A_%a.out",
    "error_file": "output_logs/DEAPderiv_%A_%a.err",
    "mail_type": "ALL",
    "mail_user": "<YOUR-EMAIL>@email.com",
    "account": "miran045",
    "partition": "amdsmall,small",
    "singularity": "required",
    "run_files": "run_files.DEAPderiv",
    "run_scripts": "run${SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID}"
  }
}
```

This script is running under the **SLURM** workload manager. It defines the following parameters for the job:

- **Job Name:** DEAPderiv
- **Time Limit:** 30 minutes
- **Memory per CPU:** 10GB
- **Temporary Storage:** 50GB
- **Output File:** output_logs/DEAPderiv_%A_%a.out
- **Error File:** output_logs/DEAPderiv_%A_%a.err
- **Mail Notifications:** All notifications
- **Email Address:** <YOUR-EMAIL>@email.com
- **Account:** miran045
- **Partition:** amdsmall,small

The script also:
- Changes the working directory to run_files.DEAPderiv
- Loads the Singularity container runtime
- Runs a bash script named "run${SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID}" 

The script relies on the **Singularity** container runtime to execute the job. The specific tasks and software used within the container are not directly specified in this script and would be defined within the "run${SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID}" script.
